message: One of my friends just sent me this link: http://tnw.co/jRor9k. Looks like a slightly different angle on the hyperlocal, super-simple Craigslist concept.
Has anyone entered their email on the signup page at stuffroulette.heroku.com?  I haven't been sending the link out much myself...
I think we were waiting a week to send the link out just to see if we can get the domain. (It's up for auction until June 4.)
That would require some deft wheel spinning animation
also, the ability to move messages between conversations would be useful

Kyle and I were wondering if we should go ahead and get stuffroulette.com, but now that I look at it on godaddy, it appears to be taken ($69 to buy). However, the whois info says that there's no match (whois doesn't know about this domain.) Did someone here snag it recently, or is Godaddy just trying to extort more money from us? :)
hmm, wish I could spin out sub conversations, or rename, as this title isn't especially helpful. It would almost be useful to just have wiki-like controls so I could call this subtopic stuffroulette.

We could keep an eye out for when it enters the 5-day "delete pending period".  I think it will be open to the public after that.  http://www.icann.org/en/tlds/agreements/verisign/registry-agmt-appc-16apr01.htm#3-4.2
This page seems to say that the domain is in "redemptionPeriod" http://www.networksolutions.com/whois-search/stuffroulette.com
feel free to tweet / RT / modify the post with your own thoughts

I just took a look at http://stuffroulette.heroku.com, and it looks like the spinner gets out of sync with the picture changer after a minute or so. Probably not a big deal, just something to keep in mind for the future.

would be sweet to have an attendee plugin that has people's information and then you can just check who made the event (with the information updating on each page if you change the person's information) however, it doesn't exist and I don't want to write it at the moment. :)
I added my whiteboard shots.  After a few failed attempts to float them to the right of the relevant text, I just added them to the image gallery you already had set up.
